result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • David J Delisle Jr was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: 36 Months suspension of driver's privileges with a $60.00 reinstatement fee.
Court Order For IDP Related Offense Driver Assessment and Driver Safety Plan Form.
Consecutive to: to run consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 1 day time served.
Conditions the same as probation except for condition time.
Court authorized an Interstate Compact to the State of Michigan for probation.

miscConds.notes:
Pay a fine of $600.00 plus costs to be taken out of bail on deposit, if any, with the balance of the fine due within one year of today's date (07-21-2016) with the remainder of the costs due during the period of the probationary period. If, revoked, Defendant shall pay up to 25% of prison funds with the balance due prior to the end of the Extended Supervision.
Pay costs, surcharges, assessments, supervision, DNA fees during the period of probation. If revoked, Defendant shall pay up to 25% of prison funds with the balance due prior to the end of the Extended Supervision.  Failure to pay shall result in a Civil Judgment with tax intercept.
Maintain full time/part time employment and or schooling.
As a convicted felon Defendant shall NEVER be in possession of any firearms / body armor / weapons.
No new law violations reaching the level of a probable cause finding.

Cooperate with agent.
Defendant required to provide a biological specimen (DNA) to the State Crime Lab.
Defendant can't vote in any election until civil rights are restored.
Participate in a Cognitive Thinking Program, and any other programming deemed appropriate by the Department and or agent.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
AODA assessment with follow up care and treatment.

timeConds.notes:
Huber privileges for work, only, 6 days a week; 12 hours per day with NO ELECTRONIC MONITORING.
**8/9/2015  defendant granted  good time granted.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David J Delisle Jr

defendant.name: Delisle, David J, Jr

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Order granting good time credit signed and filed.  Copy sent to Defendant and State.
Per Order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. William Brash, Br. 21, for review. mag
post judgment motion dated July 28, 2015. tf
Associated with Charge #1

Statements made as to Sentencing by both counsel and Defendant.

AS TO COUNT 1 (OWI 5th):  COURT SENTENCED Defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 44 MONTHS, to run consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 1 day time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 20 MONTHS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 24 MONTHS.  

Defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program
Defendant IS eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.

Court IMPOSED AND STAYED this sentence and placed the Defendant on probation for a period of 30 MONTHS.  

COURT ORDERED THE FOLLOWING CONDITIONS AS TO PROBATION / EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
*  No new law violations reaching the level of a probable cause finding.
*  Cooperate with agent.
*  Pay costs, surcharges, assessments, supervision, DNA fees during the period of probation. If revoked, Defendant shall pay up to 25% of prison funds with the balance due prior to the end of the Extended Supervision.  Failure to pay shall result in a Civil Judgment with tax intercept.
*  Maintain full time / part time employment and or schooling.
*  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
*  AODA assessment with follow up care and treatment.
*  Pay a fine of $600.00 plus costs to be taken out of bail on deposit, if any, with the balance of the fine due within one year of today's date (07-21-2016) with the remainder of the costs due during the period of the probationary period. If, revoked, Defendant shall pay up to 25% of prison funds with the balance due prior to the end of the Extended Supervision.
*  Defendant required to provide a biological specimen (DNA) to the State Crime Lab.
*  As a convicted felon Defendant shall NEVER be in possession of any firearms / body armor / weapons.
*  Defendant can't vote in any election until civil rights are restored.
*  36 Months suspension of driver's privileges with a $60.00 reinstatement fee.
*  24 Months Ignition Interlock Device.
*  Participate in a Cognitive Thinking Program, and any other programming deemed appropriate by the Department and or agent.

Court authorized an Interstate Compact to the State of Michigan for probation.

CONDITION OF PROBATION:  COURT SENTENCED Defendant to serve 8 MONTHS Condition Time at the House of Correction (HOC) with Huber privileges for work, only, 6 days a week; 12 hours per day with NO ELECTRONIC MONITORING.    Court ordered Defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Received and filed with court:
*  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence Form
*  Court Order For IDP Related Offense Driver Assessment and Driver Safety Plan Form
*  Pretrial Incarceration Credit Form
*  Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement Form
*  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief Form

Defendant David J Delisle in court with attorney Gregory Francis Rothstein.  Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 

AS TO COUNT 1 (As to OWI 5th):    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found Defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

AS TO COUNT 2 (PAC 5th):  On motion of the State, and by Operation of Law Court ordered Count 2 DISMISSED.
WCS Report received and filed with court.
Sentencing Memorandum received and filed with court.
Various letters for Court to review prior to sentencing received and filed.
